flow.descriptionCdata:
17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.034a9c67-a601-44bd-ac53-ac7e27f15226.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.13b20b37-9c67-47f2-980f-b6d0e1ddd59e.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.1b9a05c5-ddd3-428a-8ae3-ce8da62e651d.description=

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:

    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.2e7ce5c9-8f60-470f-96d8-939e42c553bb.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.

17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.539e7d6e-8200-4a12-a57a-3d513b0903fc.description=Check disk size, if disk size less than 10GB the disk size needs to be in MB 



Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.58c57c88-e3bd-4bd2-ae27-a1dea0b4f5bf.description=Retrieves the server(s) ServerVO properties Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. agent - The agent name search string (can be a partial name and multiple return results can be returned; the matching type for this input can be selected by using the 'matching' flag). matching - A flag that indicates if the search performed using the agent name should be based on a partial or exact match. The default value for this input is 'Begins With'. serverID - The ID of the searched server. This input should be used for unique identification. If provided, then the 'agent' input is ignored. delimiter - The delimiter used to separate the result values. By default the values are comma delimited. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: createdBy - The name of the user who created this object. createdDate - The date that this object was created. id - The unique ID of this object. createdBy - The name of the user who created this object. createdDate - The date that this object was created. dirtyAttributes - A ; delimited list of attributes that are dirty (Modified and not yet fully propagated). modifiedBy - The user who last modified this object. modifiedDate - The date that this object was last modified on. description - The description of this object. hostname - The DNS hostname of this object. model - The model of this object. osVersion - The version of the OS running on the object. primaryIP - The primary IP address of this object. serialNumber - This object's serial number. manufacturer - The manufacturer of this object. name - The name of this object version - The version of this object codeset - The Code set of this object. customerName - The name of the customer this object was created for. defaultGW - The default gateway used when accessing this object. discoveredDate - The date when this object was first discovered. facilityName - The name of the facility housing this object. locale - The locale this object is in. lockComment - The comment on this object's locked. NOTE\: object may not be locked. lockDate - The date this object was last locked. lockUser - The user who locked this object last. isLocked - A boolean value specifying whether or not this object is currently locked. loopbackIP - The loopback ip address used by this object. managementIP - The management ip address used by this object. mid - mid The server's management identifier. NetBIOSName - The full netBIOS (Windows networking) name for this object. lifecycle - The state in the Opsware lifecycle that this object is currently in. origin - The origin of the managed server. ASSIMILATED or PROVISIONED osFlavor - The flavor of the OS running on this object. For example\: Windows. osSPVersion - The service pack version of the OS running on the object. peerIP - The managed server's peer IP address. platformName - The name of the platform. previousSWRegDate -The last time the Opsware agent reported the installed software on the server. realmName - The name of the realm this object is in. stage - The stage of the managed server. state - The current state of the managed server\: OK, UNREACHABLE or MAINTENANCE use - The intended use of the managed server (i.e. its role in a deployment)\: DEVELOPMENT, STAGING, PRODUCTION or UNKNOWN. virtualizationType - The virtualization type. 17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.5d166d16-0316-4dba-8c63-0506357aebb7.description=

Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$.

17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.adf7e7c1-5221-469e-a493-788328d2156c.description=For disk sizes less than 10GB we need to use MB. multiply with 1024 to get MB 
Multiplies two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The product of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.de4fa28f-1a5b-4061-a810-2393ae9bfc61.description=
Checks the current date and time, and returns its representation as an Epoch (Unix) timestamp.

Results\:
    returnResult - Current date and time in timestamp format.

Responses\:
    success - Date/time retrieved successfully.
    failure - Date/time could not be retrieved.
17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.description=This flow will format and mount initial and additional datadisks to virtual and physical servers. The inputs are\: server.os Mandatory - should contain 'win' in case of windows, and '2008' or '2012' to make a difference between those two isAdditional Mandatory - should be 'True' if the disk that is added is not the first initial datadisk, but an additional one lun.wwname Only required for additional Linux datadisks disk.filesystem Only required for Linux servers server.hostname Madatory disk.mountpoint Not used at the moment. Can be used later to specifiy a mountpoint. See memo in the flow. disk.size Mandatory for Windows (All servers), and for Linux virtual servers isVirtual Mandatory - should be 'True' if the server is a virtual server. False for physical servers 17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.e150694b-8fb9-47f3-abfa-66ef8b5a812a.transition.description=formatDiskW2K12_SQL.PS1 17d40a5b-6f96-4810-8954-64186c7c870e.e6e417ee-fdf1-42c7-bc1b-5ac6611e7029.description=

    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$.

Results\:

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

flow.name: AddDiskPostProcessing

staticBinding.value: SIZEFROMOOGB=${disk.size} LASTDEV=`ls /dev/sd*|sort|tail -1` SIZEMB=`sfdisk -s $LASTDEV` SIZEGB=`expr \`expr $SIZEMB / 1024\` / 1024` if [ $SIZEGB -eq $SIZEFROMOOGB ]; then DEV=$LASTDEV; else DEV=NOT_THE_RIGHT_DISK; fi if [ ! $DEV = "NOT_THE_RIGHT_DISK" ]; then file -s $DEV |grep data 2>&1 > /dev/zero if [ $? -gt 0 ]; then DEV=FILE_SYSTEM_ON_DISK; else DEV=$DEV; fi fi echo $DEV
